page.title: 01Bakewell - An Introduction
page.content: Bakewell is a rural market town situated in the High Peak district of Derbyshire. The surrounding area included in this block consists of meadow which is used for agricultural purposes. There is in the area a fine late medieval building, Haddon Hall, owned by the Duke of Rutland, who also owns a large amount of agricultural land in the area. In Bakewell itself, you will find many examples of Georgian and Jacobean architecture. Today, Bakewell's prime function is as a centre of trade for the surrounding villages and hamlets. Its situation on the A6, the main route way in Derbyshire, means that it is a prime market town and also an important centre for tourism.
